Description: Egyptian Greek terracotta figure of (Sothic?) dog. Dark red brown Nile silt fabric with abundant fine gold mica, quartz and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Probably local representation of Sothic dog, representation of the Dog Star, Sirius, associated with Isis.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.193) (Phase 1)
Gutch 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis, D. The Terracottas (p. 96, nos 338-339)
